FuncDef: The reset patch-configure next-startup command clears the patch file to be used at the next startup.

ParaDef.Info:
Specify the patch file name.
The value is a string of 5 to 63 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Clears the patch file to be used at the next startup.
-

Examples: Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...done.
Info: Succeeded in clearing startup the patch.
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...done.
Error: This is not a patch for next startup.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the startup patch command has been run to specify the patch file to be used at the next startup, you can specify the name of the patch file in the reset patch-configure next-startup command, and then run this command to clear the configuration of the specified patch file.
Precautions
After running the reset patch-configure next-startup command, the system will not automatically load and run the patch file after being restarted.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
